name: Kobe Bryant
religion: Bryant was raised a Roman Catholic and still participates in the faith.
politicalViews: Kobe is pals with Barack Obama--a Democrat--and has spoken out about human rights violations. But he's not too keen on gay people.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.sourceTitle: How many godchildren does Kobe Bryant have in the Catholic Church
content.text: Kobe Bryant was born and raised in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He was brought up and still is a Roman Catholic and even participates in the Catholic tradition of God-parenting, godfather to a niece and the son of a good friend.
In times of trouble (like a high-profile sexual assault case), Kobe leans on his faith, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Kobe Bryant must stand trial, judge rules
content.text: I've pretty much done all I can here and, you know, God will carry me the rest of the way, so I'm pretty comfortable with that.
Even though the case was settled out of court, one might speculate that Kobe would have had no problem switching religions if things didn't work out. He once said:

content.sourceTitle: Kobe Bryant: I wouldn't mind being Jewish
content.text: I wouldn't mind being Jewish. I wouldn't mind. Really.
Rubbing elbows in the halls of power

content.sourceTitle: President Obama and Kobe Bryant talk some trash
content.text: Politically, Kobe is connected. It seems like he's a real buddy of President Obama's. They've been spotted cracking jokes at each others' expense,

content.sourceTitle: President Obama shaves a small boy as Kobe Bryant watches

content.text: and there are even reports of Kobe and his crew showing up at the White House uninvited for a visit. President Obama said once:

content.sourceTitle: Barack Obama, Lakers Give Championship Feeling to Boys & Girls Club
content.text: Kobe and Derek [Fisher] have been there so many times now, they could lead tours themselves.
Kobe has lent his star power to political causes outside of the U.S. as well, taking a stand against genocide in Darfur with an international aid organization called Aid Still Required, Kobe said:

content.sourceTitle: Kobe Bryant knows a genocide when he sees it
content.text: If we can unite people who are willing to take a stand, miracles can happen.

Even though Kobe seems to be a Democrat (who are associated with social tolerance), he doesn't seem to be so tolerant. One of the biggest Kobe controversies (along with the sexual assault charges of course) was when he called a basketball referee a "fucking faggot." The NBA fined Bryant $100,000 for the slur
and Kobe apologized, but that's definitely not a sign of a good Democratâ€“or Christian for that matter.
